intro: Euphrasia dunensis, commonly known as the Dun Valley eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and typically grows in grassy habitats and along roadsides. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent yellow markings, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Euphrasia dunensis is often found in calcareous soils and is considered a characteristic species of the British flora.
